item.title: BREAKING: With a 7-0 vote Montbello High School will re-open in...
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

BREAKING:

With a 7-0 vote Montbello High School will re-open in 2022! In my VP Kamala Harris voice, we did it Jen!
item.author: Tay Anderson

item.title: If students can play contact sports in Denver Public Schools...
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

If students can play contact sports in Denver Public Schools during COVID, I support finding ways to reinstate extracurricular activities like theater!

Great job to the students that came to our Denver School Board meeting advocating for us to do just this!
item.author: Tay Anderson

item.title: “Our Black Lives Matter sign makes us feel safe ... but we...
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

“Our Black Lives Matter sign makes us feel safe ... but we need to keep it up ALL year round!”

Today in our School Board meeting we heard directly from students at Mcglone Academy and from their podcast “The Voice of Montbello”
item.author: Tay Anderson

item.title: Question for folks that are against shortening breaks to avoid...
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

Question for folks that are against shortening breaks to avoid hot classrooms:

Would you support schools have the autonomy to call “Remote Heat Days or Weeks” for the days that are extremely hot in August?

** This is question to solicit feedback from Denver parents, students, and educators **
item.author: Tay Anderson

item.title: What would a school calendar look like that starts on August...
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

What would a school calendar look like that starts on August 30th instead of August 13th??

- 3 day Thanksgiving break
- 2 days less for Winter break
- Summer Break would begin on June 4th

...

It is likely that we will continue masking up through the next school year, so we must do our part to take away barriers that exist for hot classrooms.

August is the second hottest month of the year, which means that temps would be cooler in classrooms for the three days of school in June we’d extend the school year into.

I am in support of this!

See More
item.author: Tay Anderson

item.title: & that’s on PERIOD.
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

& that’s on PERIOD.

Four Denver students who’ve pushed to diversify the curriculum will serve on a student advisory board for an innovative new U.S. history textbook called Black History 365.

co.chalkbeat.org

Denver students to advise on new national Black history curriculum

item.title: Teachers ≠ Babysitters, I said what I said.
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

Teachers ≠ Babysitters, I said what I said.
item.author: Tay Anderson

item.title: I have decided to vote ‘NO’ on any proposed school calendar...
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

I have decided to vote ‘NO’ on any proposed school calendar that begins before August 30th.

Many schools lack the proper ventilation and are without air conditioning. Our students and educators deserve better than heat induced classrooms!
item.author: Tay Anderson

item.title: Today I asked Denver Public Schools to provide the School Board...
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

Today I asked Denver Public Schools to provide the School Board with instructions on how to opt-out of CMAS in multiple languages and ensure families their students would NOT be punished in ANY way for opting-out.
item.author: Tay Anderson

item.title: I was in a fifth grade class last week and was asked “Why do...
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

I was in a fifth grade class last week and was asked “Why do you wear a hat?”

I told them the story and how I use it as my own “Superman cape.”

After I had logged off that same student went to grab his own hat and turned it backwards saying, “This is my Superman cape.” ❤️
item.author: Tay Anderson

item.title: Today my community cabinet voted to call on the state...
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

Today my community cabinet voted to call on the state legislature to suspend CMAS for the 2021 school year.

Here is their statement:

item.title: Our students should NOT be forced to come back to schools, turn...
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

Our students should NOT be forced to come back to schools, turn in their technology, and take standardized tests for the benefit of those at the top.

SIGN THIS PETITION FOR DENVER PUBLIC SCHOOLS!

Opt Out Denver: DPS Opt Your Students Out of CMAS! (Opten por no a CMAS!)

item.author: Tay Anderson

item.title: Elections are never ending in Denver! We have an election for...
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

Elections are never ending in Denver!

We have an election for the Denver School Board this November and I am excited to endorse Scott Esserman for Denver School Board At-Large!

Scott is a retired educator and current DPS parent who understands why parents must make tough choices when picking what school is best for their children. As an educator he has dedicated his life to ensuring ALL students have equitable resources and will take that same passion to fighting for our ch...ildren.

Instead of running a campaign of tearing people down, he is busy lifting people up! He is an advocate for educators, students, and community!

I hope you will join me in supporting this champion for educational justice!

See More
item.author: Tay Anderson

item.title: In acknowledging the difficulty the COVID-19 pandemic continues...
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

In acknowledging the difficulty the COVID-19 pandemic continues to present to our school staff, students, and families, the Denver Public Schools’ Board of Education calls on Governor Jared Polis, the State Board of Education, and the Colorado General Assembly to urge the Colorado Commissioner of Education and Department of Education to submit an application to the federal government to waive required standardized assessment.

item.title: Families of Color have been disproportionately impacted by...
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

Families of Color have been disproportionately impacted by COVID. It only makes sense to vaccinate their educators first.

Such prioritization puts "a focus on our students who need us most," a district official said.

co.chalkbeat.org

Denver to prioritize teachers at high-poverty schools for COVID-19 vaccine

Such prioritization puts "a focus on our students who need us most," a district official said.Such prioritization puts "a focus on our students who need us most," a district official said.
item.author: Tay Anderson

item.title: *** Social Media Policy *** Guidelines for functioning in an...
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

*** Social Media Policy ***

Guidelines for functioning in an electronic world are the same as the values, ethics and respectability policies expected to live every day. You can expect discussions on many topics and many viewpoints in my posts. You can also expect the following:

*Engagement in healthy, open and honest dialogues

...

*Welcoming of constructive criticism

*Corrections of inaccurate or misleading postings

*Deletion of posts that are spam, inappropriate, defamatory, use profanity, and/or otherwise offensive

*An understanding that respect goes both ways — I will use good judgment in my posts and respond to you in a respectful manner. In return, I ask the same of you. (If instances of bullying and/or harassment take place, I may unfriend, block and or report the matter to Facebook, depending on the seriousness of the situation.)

*Honoring of our differences — I will not tolerate discrimination (including age, sex, race, color, creed, religion, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, citizenship, disability, or marital status or any other legally recognized protected basis under federal, state, or local laws, regulations or ordinances).

For further questions on this policy please email me at Tay_Anderson@dpsk12.org

See More
item.author: Tay Anderson
